intro: Barbarea oligosperma, commonly known as rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. It produces small, yellow flowers and has a basal rosette of leaves. Its seeds are small and are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas in its native habitat.
